title.narrative: Core support to EPF Georgia phase III

description.narrative:
Improved civil society capacity and long-term sustainability to address societal needs.
Impact Indicator: % of targeted communities noting improved civic participation in public decision making process to address societal needs (50% by end of project year 5)

Eurasia Partnership Foundation (EPF) Georgien har ansökt om kärnstöd och insatsen heter "Core support to Eurasia Partnership Foundation Georgia 2014-2019". Sida har gett stöd till EPF i två tidigare "faser" sedan 2008.
Det övergripande målet för stödet till EPF i Georgien är att skapa förutsättningar för ökat deltagande i det civila samhället samt att öka medborgarnas inflytande över samhällsutvecklingen. EPF har stor räckvidd och når ut till gräsrotsorgansationer samt aktivister genom bidrag till partnerorganisationer och kapacitetsutveckling. EPF implementerar dessutom egna projekt som bidrar till att uppfylla organisationens mål. EPF:s projekt och bidrag handlar om EU-integrationen, att unga människor blir förändringsaktörer i sina lokala samhällen, att främja socialt företagande och att öka civilsamhällets deltagande i beslutsfattande. En del av stödet planeras fortsatt att gå till den s.k. "open-door" mekanismen där EPF löpande stödjer initiativ av pilotkaraktär som kan replikeras i andra kontexter. Speciellt fokus vid denna projektfas planeras ligga vid stöd till organisationer på landsbygden. Utvalda organisationer får stöd tillsammans med organisationsutvecklingsstöd.
Insatsens budget är 38,1 MSEK. EPF:s övriga givare ger projektstöd och är bland annat USAID, EU UNDP/COBERM.
Eurasia Partnership Foundation (EPF) Georgia has applied for support "Core Support for Partnership Foundation (EPF) Georgia 2014-2019". Sida has supported EPF in two phases since 2008.
The overarching goal for the support to EPF is to empower people to effect change for social justice and economic prosperity through hands-on programs, helping them to improve their communities and their own lives. EPF is reaching out to grassroot organizations, particularly in the regions, by providing grants and by implementing projects. It focuses on creating opportunities for civic participation in public policy making, promoting social enterprises, EU integration and engaging youth. A part of the project is planned to continue to go to the so called "open-door" mechanism, where EPF supports pilot projects that foster civic engagement and projects that have the potential to be replicated. A special focus will lay with supporting organizations in the regions. Selected organizations will receive institutional development and/or core support.
The intervention's total budget is 38,1 million SEK. Other donors to EPF include UNDP/COBERM and EU.

The overarching goal for the intervention and the core support to EPF Georgia is to create opportunities for civic engagement thereby increasing citizens' influence on the society's development. EPF reaches out to grassroot organizations, particularly in the regions, by providing grants and by implementing projects.It focuses on civic participation, engaging youth, social enterprising and EU-integration

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

title.narrative: Agreement on Core support to EPF Georgia
Amended Agreement on Core support to EPF

Decision on Contribution, Core support to Eurasia EPF Georgia

description.narrative:
During the reporting period, several relevant and interesting results were reached across EPF programs:
For a more accountable, transparent, and needs-based public policy making in Georgia, EPF launched a new initiative, Watchdog Reporting for Change, which aims at empowering journalists, media outlets, and civil society actors to expose instances of poor governance in Georgia through fact-finding, reporting, and advocacy activities, so as to create positive changes for families and communities across the country.
Following EPF's efforts, the Ministry of Finance (MoF) of Georgia officially applied and became a member of the Global Initiative for Budget Transparency (GIFT) Network. As of July 2020, both EPF and MoF are among the General Stewards of the network. This new format of cooperation has put Georgia on the map of the global network and will allow EPF and MoF to play a more engaged role in the guidance of this multistakeholder action network, which is already known for the plurality of voices and for the reach of its technical expertise.
EPF succeeded in moving most of its youth-related activities online and continued to contribute to enhanced female and male youth volunteerism and civic engagement in 27 communities across Georgia by mobilizing more than 1,518 volunteers and benefiting more than 4,721 community members. The Foundation's efforts to bolster youth civic participation translated into 70 community initiatives outside EPF support.
In line with its mandates and programmatic objectives, EPF decided to study the challenges facing women-owned SMEs, including in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. The research report was completed in late November 2020 and presented to a larger audience in December 2020, which included representatives of CSOs, SMEs, the World Bank and other international organizations, and the Ministry of Economy and Sustainable Development, which is in charge of the preparation of the 2021-2025 SME strategy.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
